What Prevents Russian Companies from Implementing AI and How an Agent Marketplace Can Change This

Nov 3, 2025

We train corporations on AI implementation across various sectors - finance, sales, recruitment, marketing, logistics. Based on our observations, due to the novelty of solutions and the lack of a unified benchmark, companies often don't understand what specifically to implement.

When implementing AI, we see typical problems in Russian companies: fragmented tools, difficulty integrating solutions into existing infrastructure, and lack of transparent metrics for evaluating AI effectiveness. Local specifics also come into play: the need for language models to understand the Russian business context and strict compliance with personal data protection legislation.

How to solve this problem and what does an AI agent marketplace have to do with it - we explained in our article for TAdviser.

We also asked market experts to share their opinions: Pavel Khmelinsky, CTO of the Commercial Division at Samolet Group, Dina Popova, Managing Partner of i-Free Group of Companies, Pavel Rykov, founder of rpa.icu, Boris Tseitlin, researcher and specialist in machine learning, Ivan Yunitsky, co-founder of VOIC LAB, and Andrey Grabarnik, Head of genAI products at Just AI.
